info.title: MyTime Public Booking API
info.description:
Load company data
          -----
          
          1. We use the Company API to get some details about the company
              * e.g.name, if it supports child booking, etc.
          
          2. We use the Locations API to get all the locations for a company
          
          3. We use the Deals API to get all the deals and all of the variations
              * e.g. A Deal can be "Pet Grooming" and a Variation is "Pet Grooming for Small Dogs"
          
          4. We use the Employees API to get all employees working at a location
          
          5. We use the Pricings API to get the pricings. The pricing is the bundle between a variation, an employee and a location.
          
              * e.g. Employee X charges 10$ to perform Variation Z at Location Y
              * e.g. Employee X charges 12$ to perform Variation W at Location Z
          
          Notes
          =====
          * If an employee doesn't have a Pricing for a Variation then he doesn't perform it.
          * If an employee doesn't have Pricings at a Location then he doesn't work there.
          
          ----
          
          Booking Flow - i.e. Creating a Purchase
          ----
          
          1. We use the OpenDate and OpenTime APIs to get the available days/hours for a combo - employee & variation(s) & pet
          2. When the end user selects an available time we do two things:
              * We create a cart using the Cart API
              * We add a cart item (includes the available time & variations & employee) using the CartItem API
          2. Optional: We can use the Client API, CustomerAddresses API, CreditCards API to manage or gather more user (i.e. client) data
          4. We use the Purchase API to complete the booking.
          
          Notes:
          =====
          * At b1) the end user shouldn't necessarily be logged in. In case he isn't we will update the user_id for a cart after login
          
          ----
          
          Removing from Cart
          ----
          
          Notes:
          =====
          * Once steps 2b) are completed there is no way to update the cart or cart item. If the end user changes his mind and wants
            to update the variations or he wants to change the time, we will drop the cart and just create a new one with new cart items (i.e. step 2b)
          
          * Once steps 2d) are completed the booking was already made so droping the cart is no longer an options. For cancelling an appointment
            we will use the Appointments API. Canceling an appointment will make the time slot available again.
          
          ----
          
          Sessions and Users
          ----
          
          1. We use the Sessions API to create a new session for an existing user. The token received should be sent on all further API calls unless the user logs out.
          2. We use the Users API for creating a new user (i.e. registration)
          
          ----
          
          OpenTimes / OpenDates
          ----
          
          1. If we want the custom variations to be applied correctly for a client or a child we need to send the 'Authorization' header for the user.
          ----

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Company Id

get.summary: Get all appointments from a company

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: The company_id for which we retrieve the appointments. If not passed we will return all appointments for the user

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The location_id for which we retrieve the appointments.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Appointment ids separated by comma. If this param is passed the pagination params will be ignored

parameters.name: normalized
parameters.description: The normalized form will return the normalized details without FK references. Default: false

parameters.name: not_paid
parameters.description: Filter only appointments which have no ticket or have a ticket with no card/cash/other payments. Not compatible with param ids. Default: false

post.description:
The Swagger Interactive UI might not work properly for this API. Here is how a CURL request would look like:
          curl "https://www.mytime.com/api/mkp/v1/classes/enrollments" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Authorization: MzCvwzyynHeQxmka5CzL" -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.108 Safari/537.36" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin" -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br" -H "Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9" --data-binary "{"company_id":1,"session_id": 2, parent_session_enrollment_id: 1, "category_id":1,"attendees":[{"children":[],"for_client_count":1,"session_attendee_id":2}],"referrer":"express_checkout","no_pay":true,"card_id":""}" --compressed

get.description: Returns a list of waitlist items for the currently authenticated client.

post.description: Adds a new item to the waitlist for a specific time slot. For appointments, the number of employee_ids must match the number of variation_ids.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Waitlist item details

begin_at.description: The start time for the waitlist slot.

end_at.description: The end time for the waitlist slot.

employee_ids.description: Comma-separated list of employee IDs. Must have the same number of items as variation_ids.

kind.description: The type of waitlist item. Defaults to 'appointment'.

422.description: Invalid parameters or error during creation.

delete.description: Removes a specific waitlist item by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the waitlist item to delete.

post.description: Redirects the user to the checkout page with the waitlist item details. This is not a standard JSON API endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the waitlist item to book.

302.description: Redirects to the checkout page on success, or back to the marketplace page on failure.

remaining_time.description: The number of seconds till the service can start

waitlist_resources.description: The resources which will be used

begin_at.description: The starting time of the bookable slot in ISO 8601 format.

end_at.description: The ending time of the bookable slot in ISO 8601 format.

errors.description: An object containing any errors specific to this time slot.

location_id.description: The id of location at which the appointment will take place

variation_ids.description: Comma-delimited list of variation ids which comprise the appointment

deal_id.description: The deal for which we add a cart item

employee_id.description: For single-staff appointments: The id of the employee who will perform the services

employee_ids.description:
For multi-staff appointments: Comma-delimited list of employee ids,
              corresponding to list of variation_ids

begin_at.description: The datetime when the appointment will start, in ISO8601 format

end_at.description: Optional - The datetime when the appointment will end, in ISO8601 format - Needs multipler enabled

begin_ats.description:
Optional - The datetimes when the services will start comma separated (one for each service),
               in ISO8601 format - Needs setting enabled

end_ats.description:
Optional - The datetimes when the services will end comma separated (one for each service),
               in ISO8601 format - Needs setting enabled

is_existing_customer.description: Current customer is new or existing

travel_to_customer.description: If business mobility is 3 send true

child_id.description: The child for which we are booking

custom_field_id.description: Use custom prices for this custom field e.g. Pet Breed Custom Field Id

custom_field_values.description: Use custom prices for this custom field value. e.g. Akita

employee_filter_value.description: Filter value for filtering employees. e.g. Male

company_id.description: The company for which we want to checkout the cart

coupon_code.description: The coupon code you want to apply

extra.description: Available only on update when assigning the cart to a user.

company_id.description: The company for which we want to checkout the cart
The company for which we want to checkout the cart

promotion_code.description: The promotion code you want to apply

cart_ids.description: The cart IDs for which you want to apply the promotion

company_id.description: The company for which you want to checkout the cart

promotion_code.description: The promotion code you want to apply

SessionEnrollmentCreateAttendee.description: Specify what attendee types are we booking (e.g.: Regular Ticket, VIP Ticket) and for whom (e.g.: For myself, for a child)

children.description: The children ids for which you want to create an enrollment

for_client_count.description: The number of enrollments you create for yourself which are not assigned to a child. If none, send 0

session_attendee_id.description: The id for the attendee type. The attendee type is the type of ticket you book. E.g.: For an event you can have Attendee Types: Regular, VIP, Student

settings.description: class settings for this attendee type

session_id.description: The session_id for which we create enrollments

parent_session_enrollment_id.description: The session_enrollment_id of parent for which we create enrollments

no_pay.description: Should the user pay online for creating the session enrollments or not. If false, card_id is required.

card_id.description: The credit card id in case you pay by card.

attendees.description: The object schema for this is described at SessionEnrollmentCreateAttendee

status.description: One of: booked, canceled, confirmed, checked_in, no_show, showed_up

child_label.description: Returned only for normalized=true. This is the guest name / pet name / vehicle type

virtual_event_token.description: Token for accessing virtual event redirect endpoint

company_id.description: Sending this parameter will return user details in context of a company e.g.: client, is_existing_customer

send_welcome_email.description: Send a welcome email to the clients

company_id.description: The company for which we will return the client

employee_ids.description: Comma-delimited list of employee_ids that open times should be returned for.

variation_ids.description: Comma-delimited list of variation_ids that open times should be returned for.

child_id.description:
Return custom prices for the selected child. Please read `OpenTimes Section. 1)`.
              Also may affect duration of services considered.

custom_field_id.description:
Return custom prices for this custom field e.g. Pet Breed Custom Field Id.
              Also may affect duration of services considered.

custom_field_values.description:
Return custom prices for this custom field value. e.g. Akita.
              Also may affect duration of services considered.

client_id.description: The additional client_id that should be added to appointment

notify.description: Define if additional client should be notified about this appointment or not

cart_id.description: The cart we want to purchase

card_id.description: The card we use for payment - Only for no_pay: false

customer_address_id.description: The customer address where the appointment will take place if company is mobile

note.description: The user note for the purchase

referrer.description: The referrer for this purchase. Option: 'booking_api'

is_embedded.description: Current customer is new or existing one

no_pay.description: Should user pay for current cart or not

item_type.description:
This will be either
          'MyClient::Appointment', 'MyClass::SessionEnrollment' or 'GiftCardPurchase'
          The other properties will depend on the type of item.

company_id.description: The company for which we will return the client

items.description: Items which will be included in the new ticket. E.g: [{ appointment_id: 1 }]

code.description: The promotion code / gift card code

id_prefix.description: Id Prefix - Support for different apple developers sign-in

company_id.description: Sending this parameter will return user details in context of a company e.g.: client, is_existing_customer
